activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Wayne Homann

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] cases #22CF336 and #22CF3377 called at 1:49pm 
Co-Defendant Amadeus Fletcher Wiltshire appears by Zoom video.  Attorney Frederick Klimetz appears by Zoom video
Co-Defendant Brandon W. Homann appears by Zoom video. 
ADA Michael Witt appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to case #22CF337-Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties. 
As to case #22CF336- right to counsel is given.  Mr. Homann indicates that he contacted the Public Defenders Office this week to apply for representation.  Preliminary Hearing time limits are tolled.
recess 1:55pm 

NEXT:  Status Conference on November 22nd at 3:00pm --the Co-Defendants and defense counsel may appear by Zoom videoconference [JA, note in comments that cases are prelim stage]
Adjourned initial appearance on September 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference in part] 
cases #22CF336 and #22CF337 called at 1:42pm 
Co-Defendant Brandon Wayne Homann appears in court.  [PD appointment of counsel pends.] 
Co-Defendant Amadeus Fletcher Wiltshire appears in court.  His counsel, Attorney Frederick F Klimetz appears by Zoom-video.
Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears in court and on Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to Case #22CF336 Homann:
--the Court continues to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits, awaiting appointment of counsel by the Public Defender 
--the Court amends the Bond to strike the condition that prohibits the Defendant from leaving the State of Wisconsin. 
--Mr. Homann indicates that the Moore Road, Sante Fe TX address is accurate  

As to Case #22CF337 Wiltshire 
--Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both counsel
--Attorney Klimetz indicates that there is no objection to the original Initial Appearance proceeding, however the Defense is requesting that Bond conditions be amended so that Mr. Wiltshire is able to return to his home in Texas. Information is provided that he has lost his employments here in the local area.
--the Court amends the Bond to strike the condition that prohibits the Defendant from leaving the State of Wisconsin.  
--Mr. Wiltshire verifies that the Mustang Road, Alvin TX address is accurate 
recess 1:50pm 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) in #22CF336 and Status Conference in #22CF337--both on September 23rd at 1:15pm by Zoom Conference --JA note in #22CF337 calendar comments that case is at prelim stage

The above-named applicant is eligible for State Public Defender
representation. The eligibility determination was made on 8/23/2022. No attorney is
available to attend the hearing scheduled for 8/24/22
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Wayne Homann
Current: 5901 Moore Rd, Santa Fe, TX 77517 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 6514 County Rd 166, Alvin, TX 77511

Conditions of this Bond include: 
--no presence at the Comfort Suites in Johnson Creek
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin

[MK] case called at 1:56pm 
Defendant Brandon Wayne Homann appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD appears for bond-purposes only, though the cash bail status may impact PD eligibility). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and Texas address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. It is noted that Mr. Homann is in this area working at the Watertown Walmart remodeling project. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is addressed.  After bond is set, Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the cash bail status makes Mr. Homann eligible for representation because Mr. Homann is unable to post the amount.
[The Initial Appearance is adjourned. The Court did not address preliminary hearing time limits.] 

The Court requires a $1,000 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no presence at the Comfort Suites in Johnson Creek
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin 
recess 1:46pm. 

NEXT:   (1) clerk- add the PD to the mailing matrix,  (2) Adjourned Initial Appearance on August 24th at 1:15pm
